intro: Campanula filicaulis var. gomarica, commonly known as the Gomarica bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
